014package org.jdbi.v3.core.statement;
015
016import java.sql.CallableStatement;
017import java.sql.PreparedStatement;
018import java.sql.SQLException;
019import java.sql.Types;
020import java.util.ArrayList;
021import java.util.List;
022import java.util.function.Consumer;
023import java.util.function.Function;
024
025import org.jdbi.v3.core.Handle;
026import org.jdbi.v3.core.argument.Argument;
027
028/**
029 * Used for invoking stored procedures.
030 */
031public class Call extends SqlStatement<Call> {
032    private final List<OutParamArgument> params = new ArrayList<>();
033
034    public Call(Handle handle, CharSequence sql) {
035        super(handle, sql);
036    }
037
038    /**
039     * Deprecated delegate - please use {@code CharSequence} signature for future compatibility.
040     */
041    public Call(Handle handle, String sql) {
042        super(handle, (CharSequence) sql);
043    }
044
045    @Override
046    PreparedStatement createStatement(final StatementContext ctx, ParsedSql parsedSql) throws SQLException {
047        return getHandle().getStatementBuilder().createCall(getHandle().getConnection(), parsedSql.getSql(), ctx);
048    }
049
050    /**
051     * Register a positional output parameter.
052     * @param position the parameter position (zero-based)
053     * @param sqlType an SQL type constant as defined by {@link java.sql.Types} or by the JDBC vendor.
054     * @return self
055     */
056    public Call registerOutParameter(int position, int sqlType) {
057        return registerOutParameter(position, sqlType, null);
058    }
059
060    /**
061     * Register a positional output parameter.
062     * @param position the parameter position (zero-based)
063     * @param sqlType an SQL type constant as defined by {@link java.sql.Types} or by the JDBC vendor.
064     * @param mapper a mapper which converts the {@link CallableStatement} to a desired output type.
065     * @return self
066     */
067    public Call registerOutParameter(int position, int sqlType, CallableStatementMapper mapper) {
068        getBinding().addPositional(position, new OutParamArgument(sqlType, mapper, null));
069        return this;
070    }
071
072    /**
073     * Register a named output parameter.
074     * @param name the parameter name
075     * @param sqlType an SQL type constant as defined by {@link java.sql.Types} or by the JDBC vendor.
076     * @return self
077     */
078    public Call registerOutParameter(String name, int sqlType) {
079        return registerOutParameter(name, sqlType, null);
080    }
081
082    /**
083     * Register a named output parameter.
084     * @param name the parameter name
085     * @param sqlType an SQL type constant as defined by {@link java.sql.Types} or by the JDBC vendor.
086     * @param mapper a mapper which converts the {@link CallableStatement} to a desired output type.
087     * @return self
088     */
089    public Call registerOutParameter(String name, int sqlType, CallableStatementMapper mapper) {
090        getBinding().addNamed(name, new OutParamArgument(sqlType, mapper, name));
091        return this;
092    }
093
094    /**
095     * Invoke the callable statement.  Note that the statement will be {@link #close()}d,
096     * so cursor-typed values may not work.
097     * @return the output parameters resulting from the invocation.
098     */
099    public OutParameters invoke() {
100        return invoke(Function.identity());
101    }
102
103    /**
104     * Invoke the callable statement and process its {@link OutParameters} results.
105     */
106    public void invoke(Consumer<OutParameters> resultConsumer) {
107        invoke((Function<OutParameters, Void>) r -> {
108            resultConsumer.accept(r);
109            return null;
110        });
111    }
112
113    /**
114     * Invoke the callable statement and process its {@link OutParameters} results,
115     * returning a computed value of type {@code T}.
116     */
117    public <T> T invoke(Function<OutParameters, T> resultComputer) {
118        try {
119            internalExecute();
120            OutParameters out = new OutParameters(getContext());
121            for (OutParamArgument param : params) {
122                Object obj = param.map((CallableStatement) stmt);
123
124                // convert from JDBC 1-based position to Jdbi's 0-based
125                int index = param.position - 1;
126                out.getMap().put(index, obj);
127
128                if (param.name != null) {
129                    out.getMap().put(param.name, obj);
130                }
131            }
132            return resultComputer.apply(out);
133        } finally {
134            close();
135        }
136    }
137
138    // TODO tostring?
139    private class OutParamArgument implements Argument {
140        private final int sqlType;
141        private final CallableStatementMapper mapper;
142        private final String name;
143        private int position;
144
145        OutParamArgument(int sqlType, CallableStatementMapper mapper, String name) {
146            this.sqlType = sqlType;
147            this.mapper = mapper;
148            this.name = name;
149            params.add(this);
150        }
151
152        @Override
153        public void apply(int outPosition, PreparedStatement statement, StatementContext ctx) throws SQLException {
154            ((CallableStatement) statement).registerOutParameter(outPosition, sqlType);
155            this.position = outPosition;
156        }
157
158        public Object map(CallableStatement stmt) {
159            try {
160                if (mapper != null) {
161                    return mapper.map(position, stmt);
162                }
163                switch (sqlType) {
164                    case Types.CLOB:
165                    case Types.VARCHAR:
166                    case Types.LONGNVARCHAR:
167                    case Types.LONGVARCHAR:
168                    case Types.NCLOB:
169                    case Types.NVARCHAR:
170                        return stmt.getString(position);
171                    case Types.BLOB:
172                    case Types.VARBINARY:
173                        return stmt.getBytes(position);
174                    case Types.SMALLINT:
175                        return stmt.getShort(position);
176                    case Types.INTEGER:
177                        return stmt.getInt(position);
178                    case Types.BIGINT:
179                        return stmt.getLong(position);
180                    case Types.TIMESTAMP:
181                        case Types.TIME:
182                        return stmt.getTimestamp(position);
183                    case Types.DATE:
184                        return stmt.getDate(position);
185                    case Types.FLOAT:
186                        return stmt.getFloat(position);
187                    case Types.DECIMAL:
188                    case Types.DOUBLE:
189                        return stmt.getDouble(position);
190                    default:
191                        return stmt.getObject(position);
192                }
193            } catch (SQLException e) {
194                throw new UnableToExecuteStatementException("Could not get OUT parameter from statement", e, getContext());
195            }
196        }
197    }
198}
